summary: Centralising logistics reduces emissions and costs while improving service, linking local operations to company-wide environmental gains.
Factory-level zero-waste practices have driven €400 million in savings and reduced environmental impact across operations.
Scaling sustainable palm-oil sourcing curbs deforestation and shields the company from volatile commodity costs.
Switching to eco-packs boosts sales and margins while cutting plastic use and emissions significantly.
Embedding sustainability drives consumer and retailer buy-in, spurs innovation, boosts employee engagement and further elevates brand sales in a reinforcing cycle.
Improving sanitation access creates new markets and drives product uptake while enhancing community health.
Nestlé’s CSV commitments link corporate practice to global challenges—driving social benefit while reinforcing the company’s role in addressing critical issues.
